page.title: 03THE CASTLE,HORNBY
page.content: The castle was built in the 13th century.It was built by the St. Quintens.It was built as a stately home not as a fighting castle.At that time most stately homes,churches and manor houses were built with battlements.In the 18th century the castle was altered.In those days it belonged to the Duke of Leeds.He owned it until 1930 when it was sold.Then some parts of it were pulled down as they were unsafe.The castle has many fields and gardens around it.Today the castle is lived in by Major-General Clutterbuck and his family.It is not at present open to the public but it is used for special village occasions especially those associated with the church.
